channel.title: Health Care : NPR
channel.description: The state of health care, health insurance, new medical research, disease prevention, and drug treatments. Interviews, news, and commentary from NPR's correspondents. Subscribe to podcasts.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2017 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: As GOP Health Care Push Moves To Senate, White House Questions Value of CBO Analysis
item.description: "I think I know the gospel pretty well," a White House spokeswoman said after the House passed a health care bill without the official legislative scoring, "and I'd say the CBO is not the gospel."
item.content:encoded:
"I think I know the gospel pretty well," a White House spokeswoman said after the House passed a health care bill without the official legislative scoring, "and I'd say the CBO is not the gospel."

(Image credit: Evan Vucci/AP)
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: What Are 'High-Risk Pools' And Do They Lower Health Care Costs?
item.description: Attorney Ryan Burt talks with NPR's Scott Simon about whether high-risk pools proposed in the House Republicans' health care plan, for people with pre-existing conditions, are enough to meet the need.
item.content:encoded: Attorney Ryan Burt talks with NPR's Scott Simon about whether high-risk pools proposed in the House Republicans' health care plan, for people with pre-existing conditions, are enough to meet the need.

item.title: The Future Of The GOP Health Care Plan
item.description: The White House claimed a victory this week with the House passage of the bill to replace the Affordable Care Act. NPR's Ron Elving joins Scott Simon to talk about the bill's prospects in the Senate.
item.content:encoded: The White House claimed a victory this week with the House passage of the bill to replace the Affordable Care Act. NPR's Ron Elving joins Scott Simon to talk about the bill's prospects in the Senate.
item.dc:creator: Ron Elving

item.title: People With Pre-Existing Conditions Worry About Losing Health Coverage
item.description: As the American Health Care Act moves toward the Senate, many people around the country are reacting to it. Among them, people with pre-existing conditions who worry about losing their coverage.
item.content:encoded: As the American Health Care Act moves toward the Senate, many people around the country are reacting to it. Among them, people with pre-existing conditions who worry about losing their coverage.

item.title: Obamacare Vs. American Health Care Act: Here's Where They Differ
item.description: NPR looks at how the Affordable Care Act and American Health Care Act differ in terms of insurance marketplaces, the individual mandate, guaranteed coverage and insurance subsidies.
item.content:encoded: NPR looks at how the Affordable Care Act and American Health Care Act differ in terms of insurance marketplaces, the individual mandate, guaranteed coverage and insurance subsidies.
item.dc:creator: Alison Kodjak

item.title: House Approval Of Health Care Bill Represents Major Victory For Trump
item.description: President Trump is still learning the ways of Washington. But House passage of the health care bill is a victory for the novice politician.
item.content:encoded: President Trump is still learning the ways of Washington. But House passage of the health care bill is a victory for the novice politician.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Senate Prepares To Consider GOP Health Care Bill
item.description: The measure passed the House on Thursday, but it's in the hands of the Senate now. Steve Inskeep talks to Democratic Sen. Tim Kaine of Virginia about the bill's chances in the Senate.
item.content:encoded: The measure passed the House on Thursday, but it's in the hands of the Senate now. Steve Inskeep talks to Democratic Sen. Tim Kaine of Virginia about the bill's chances in the Senate.

item.title: What's Next For The Republican Health Care Plan
item.description: Republicans in the House have passed a bill to change the health care system. But it faces changes in the Senate.
item.content:encoded: Republicans in the House have passed a bill to change the health care system. But it faces changes in the Senate.
item.dc:creator: Susan Davis

item.title: Health Care Vote Could Threaten Republican House Majority
item.description: Some of the most vulnerable House Republicans voted in favor of the GOP health care plan — and Democrats are already trying to use it against them ahead of the 2018 midterm elections.
item.content:encoded:
Some of the most vulnerable House Republicans voted in favor of the GOP health care plan — and Democrats are already trying to use it against them ahead of the 2018 midterm elections.

(Image credit: Nicholas Kamm/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Jessica Taylor

item.title: 5 Things To Watch As GOP Health Bill Moves To The Senate
item.description: Just three "no" votes by Senate Republicans would likely be enough to sink the GOP health bill. Democrats who lost the battle in the House are still convinced they can win the political war.
item.content:encoded:
Just three "no" votes by Senate Republicans would likely be enough to sink the GOP health bill. Democrats who lost the battle in the House are still convinced they can win the political war.

(Image credit: Eric Thayer/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Julie Rovner

item.title: American Hospital Association Head Outlines Opposition To GOP Health Bill
item.description: NPR's Robert Siegel talks with Rick Pollack, president and CEO of the American Hospital Association, about how the Republican health care plan would affect hospitals and why he opposes it.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Robert Siegel talks with Rick Pollack, president and CEO of the American Hospital Association, about how the Republican health care plan would affect hospitals and why he opposes it.

item.title: House Passes Revised Version Of Republican Health Care Bill
item.description: Over a month after abruptly pulling their plan to repeal and replace Obamacare from the floor, House Republicans voted Wednesday on a revised version of that bill.
item.content:encoded: Over a month after abruptly pulling their plan to repeal and replace Obamacare from the floor, House Republicans voted Wednesday on a revised version of that bill.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Winners And Losers Under The House GOP Health Bill
item.description: The version of the American Health Care Act passed by the House eliminates taxes on corporations and wealthy people and shrinks Medicaid coverage. A chart breaks down who would be affected and how.
item.content:encoded:
The version of the American Health Care Act passed by the House eliminates taxes on corporations and wealthy people and shrinks Medicaid coverage. A chart breaks down who would be affected and how.

(Image credit: J. Scott Applewhite/AP)
item.dc:creator: Joe Neel

item.title: Here Is What's In The House-Approved Health Care Bill
item.description: The House GOP's bill to replace the Affordable Care Act would all but eliminate the requirement that people buy health insurance and shrink Medicaid coverage. It also cuts taxes for the wealthy.
item.content:encoded:
The House GOP's bill to replace the Affordable Care Act would all but eliminate the requirement that people buy health insurance and shrink Medicaid coverage. It also cuts taxes for the wealthy.

(Image credit: Eric Thayer/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Alison Kodjak

item.title: House Republicans To Bring Healthcare Overhaul Bill Back To The Floor
item.description: NPR congressional correspondent Sue Davis has the latest on Republican plans to vote on repealing and replace the Affordable Care Act.
item.content:encoded: NPR congressional correspondent Sue Davis has the latest on Republican plans to vote on repealing and replace the Affordable Care Act.
item.dc:creator: Susan Davis
